text: After years of repeated conspiracies that President Barack Obama was not born in the United States, Donald Trump finally retreated from the so-called birth movement earlier this month. However, this did not prevent the question from being asked during an exchange of keys in the presidential debate held on Monday in New York. Hillary Clinton said Trump embraced a "racial lie" and showed a pattern of his business practices. "Donald began his career again in 1973 by the Ministry of Justice on charges of racial discrimination because he was not renting apartments in one of his developments for Americans of African descent," she said. This is exactly the charge, but is it true? Yeah. It turned out to be. In 1973, Trump, aged 27, was the head of his father's real estate company, Trump Administration. It operates approximately 40 residential buildings, mostly in New York City. By all accounts, including his own country, Trump was a very practical and active leader in day-to-day business operations management. In that year, the Federal Government filed a complaint against Trump, his father Fred Trump, and the Trump Administration. The complaint alleged that Tramps violated the Fair Housing Act, which is part of the Civil Rights Act 1968, by discriminating against tenants and potential tenants on the basis of their race. "The defendants, through the actions of their agents and employees, discriminate against persons on account of race in the operation of their apartment buildings," the complaint states. Blacks were often told, as the Government found, that the Trump management complex was not available when apartments were available for rent. In one case, a black man asked about two-bedroom apartments at the Westminster compound in Trump, Brooklyn, on 18 March 1972, and one of the supervisors told him that there was nothing. On March 19, 1972, the black, white man's wife visited the compound and offered him an application for a two-bedroom apartment at the site. Government lawyers also interviewed several people who said that the executive directors of the Trump Department did not encourage leasing agents to rent to blacks. In one case, the Government stated that the company ' s Comptroller had ordered the lease agent to attach a "C" paper to each application submitted by a coloured person.
